definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: Now let's come back to the topic about Ice Age again.
sentences.chinese: 现在让我们再回到冰河期的话题上吧。

sentences.english: And those plants may have caused the next great ice age.
sentences.chinese: 那些植物可能导致了下一次大冰河期的到来。

sentences.english: How come a big ice age happened when carbon dioxide levels were high?
sentences.chinese: 在大冰河期，二氧化碳含量水平怎么会高呢？

sentences.english: Most of us know that there have ever been Ice Ages on the earth three times.
sentences.chinese: 我们大多数人都知道地球上曾有过三次冰河期。

sentences.english: Bing Heqi with the ice in the Bay drift on the continuous erosion.
sentences.chinese: 它与冰河期的冰块，在湾内飘移时的不断冲刷有关。

sentences.english: Now, perhaps Ice Age will disappear on the earth forever.
sentences.chinese: 现在，恐怕冰河期将永远在地球上消失了。

definition: Holocene (geological period covering approx 12000 years since the last ice age)
Pleistocene (geological epoch from 2m years ago, covering the most recent ice ages)
fourth period/quaternary (geological period covering the recent ice ages over the last 180,000 years)
